column1: I had a great time returning to my alma mater and meeting with the University of South Carolina @GamecockECON today. Thank you to all of these bright young men and women for the great questions and dialogue! https://t.co/TGsJPeL42o

. @realdonaldtrump and pro-growth Republican policies have supercharged our economy and all Americans are benefiting. Thank you President Trump! https://t.co/up6iOQ42Fg

Saddened to learn of the passing of my collegue Rep. Elijah Cummings. He was a dedicated public servant who will be greatly missed by many. Sending prayers to his family and loved ones during this time.
The impeachment process started the day after the election and it’s time for the Democrats to put the American people before their political interests.

It has been 313 days since the President signed the USMCA with Mexico and Canada. And yet still no vote.   Instead the Democrats continue to try to undo the 2016 election. They struck out with the Kavanaugh hearings and they struck out with the Mueller Investigation.

President Trump has the bases loaded with record low unemployment rates 2% GDP growth and a competitive economy once again.   However Speaker Pelosi is denying the American people the grand slam they deserve by not bringing USMCA to the House floor for a vote.
Huge news: Unemployment has reached a 50 year low! We will keep focused on growing our economy and creating opportunity! https://t.co/AAOFgCcA4L

Democrats have tried and failed to relitigate the 2016 election since the day President Trump was sworn into office. While they continue their political attacks we will keep our focus on improving the lives of Americans and South Carolinians.

It’s disappointing but not surprising that the Democrats have launched an impeachment inquiry based on an unverified second-hand account rather than waiting 24 hours for President Trump’s voluntary release of the full transcript of the phone call.

South Carolinians didn’t send me to Congress to spend money the government doesn’t have. If we expect the American people to live within their means Congress should be held accountable to operate a balanced budget.

I could not in good conscience support today’s CR that keeps us on an unsustainable fiscal path and sets us up to embrace trillion-dollar deficits. We must take steps to fix the broken budgeting process so this debt does not pile onto the backs of our children and grandchildren.

(4/4) Wrenzie and I are praying for the victims and their families and are grateful for the bravery of the first responders whose quick action saved countless lives.
(3/4) We also must address the rise of hatred in our culture that is plaguing our country. No one should be scared when they go to school their place of worship or to the store.

(2/4) I have introduced bipartisan legislation that would close the “Charleston Loophole” and ensure law enforcement has all relevant information at their disposal to quickly determine if someone should be allowed to purchase a gun.

(1/4) Our nation is shaken by the tragedies in Texas and Ohio. We must unite against this senseless violence and condemn hatred in any form. Congress should work in a bipartisan fashion to close loopholes that allow sick people to have firearms.

Another month of strong economic growth in July:  📈164000 new jobs 🏆Record-high labor force participation of 163.4 million 💵 Wages up 3.2% ⬇️Historically low unemployment  @realDonaldTrump's economy continues to grow & create opportunities for workers across the country!

This burden will be shouldered by our children and grandchildren and my constituents deserve better.
A two year suspension on the debt-limit will put us right back here in two years. We need to fix the broken process that got us here and make the tough decisions required to balance our budget.

I could not support yesterday's budget bill which will add nearly $2 trillion to the federal debt over the next 10 years. At a time when we need to rein in our spending this bill keeps us on an unsustainable path.

I invite the entire @postandcourier editorial board to come up from Charleston and join me in the Seventh District so that they can see with their own eyes why we need I-73.
You love to complain about the corridor of shame but you don’t want to do anything to bring opportunity to this depressed region. People in my district are tired of being left behind!

Agriculture and tourism remain South Carolina’s biggest industries and the Pee Dee and Grand Strand produce an inordinately large portion of both. But we can’t grow without infrastructure and I-73 is the best investment we can make for our region and our state.
